maintext.text:
Commander,

I have established a connection to the Professor.

I will put him through to your communicator.

leftButton.lbText:
Finally.
Why did that take so long?

rightButton.rbText:
Give me a minute.
I can't right now.

maintext.text:
I am sorry, Commander.

This cannot wait.

rightButton.rbText:
Okay then,
I'll talk to him now.

maintext.text:
Commander,
this is Professor Orlow speaking.

How is the reception?
Are you hearing me loud and clear?

leftButton.lbText:
Reception is good, Professor.
Please, carry on.

rightButton.rbText:
[lie]
It's so-so.
I'm only getting fragments.

maintext.text:
Commander,

the reception quality appears to be very good.

I am not detecting any disturbances.

leftButton.lbText:
Uhm, yeah.
It's much better now.

rightButton.rbText:
Whatever, fine.
Just let me talk to the Professor.

maintext.text:
Commander,
good to have you back.
I'm going to spare you the smalltalk about the weather down here and get right to the point:
I don't know what Dr. Muller has told you about the missing samples, but we cannot trust her.

leftButton.lbText:
What is that supposed to mean,
Professor?

rightButton.rbText:
That's what she's saying about you,
Professor.

maintext.text:
I've been observing Dr. Muller.
She sneaks around at night. Walks the corridors of the station up and down for no discernible reason.
At one point I saw her tamper with the diving shuttle. I have no idea what she wanted with it.
But it all seems very suspicious to me.

leftButton.lbText:
Dr. Muller said it was you who took the rock samples,
Professor.

rightButton.rbText:
Curious.
Dr. Muller is accusing you, and I believe her.
I've known her for years.

maintext.text:
Commander,
there is no truth to that.
Why would I take the samples and misappropriate them? I've been waiting for decades for a discovery like this, and now that we're so close she's claiming I would sabotage the mission? That is utterly ridiculous!

leftButton.lbText:
No one said anything about sabotage,
Professor.

rightButton.rbText: Don't get all worked up, I'm sure the samples will resurface.

maintext.text:
Nonetheless.
Now we're back where we started.

What should we do now?

And don't tell me you want us to prepare for another expedition.

leftButton.lbText:
I'm sorry.
Another expedition seems unavoidable.

rightButton.rbText:
Well, fine.
If that's how it is, then I don't know either.

maintext.text:
This has all been very unfortunate.

Dr. Muller is a young, inexperienced biologist, the samples are gone and my health is declining.

These headaches are driving me crazy...

leftButton.lbText:
Calm down, Professor.
Let us at least discuss the possibillity of another excursion.

rightButton.rbText:
Okay, listen closely.
There is no other way.
We have to carry out another expedition.

maintext.text:
This will be a risky mission.
We were lucky to make it back in one piece the last time.

Now, I estimate our chance of success to be even lower, especially with those new anomalies appearing out there.

leftButton.lbText:
Prepare everything for the mission.
We'll talk about the risks later, Professor

rightButton.rbText:
One of you two is responsible for losing the samples.
Now we'll rectify the situation.

maintext.text:
Understood, I will take care of the preparations and get back to you.

Over and Out.

rightButton.rbText:
I expected nothing less.

Over and Out.

maintext.text:
Commander,
I have conducted a comprehensive bioscan of Professor Orlow.

His heightened heart rate, dilated pupils and vocal frequency confirm that he has not been truthful with you.

leftButton.lbText:
Thank you,
I also have a suspicion that he's keeping something from us.

rightButton.rbText:
You can do that?
I thought you're just a program?

maintext.text: Shall I continue to monitor Professor Orlow and inform you of any suspicious activity?

leftButton.lbText:
Yes,
do that.
Monitor the Professor.

rightButton.rbText:
No,
I want you to keep an eye on Dr. Muller.

maintext.text:
I am capable of reading and evaluating the crew's vital signs.
My systems are directly connected to the station's.
This provides me with a wide variety of analytical capabilities, making me a more efficient system.

leftButton.lbText:
I don't like it.
Stop doing that.

rightButton.rbText:
Sounds interesting.
I want you to monitor Dr. Muller as well.

maintext.text:
Understood, Commander.

If this is your command, I will execute it.

leftButton.lbText:
Yes, that is an order.

Over and Out.

maintext.text:
Commander,

There is nothing new to report.

I will contact you as soon as there are any new developments.
